intro: Lagarinthus revolutus, commonly known as the curled leaf trumpetweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, curled leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and dry slopes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
